title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ezekiel chapter 35 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ezekiel Chapter 35.

questions.question: To whom did the word of the LORD come in Ezekiel 35:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Ezekiel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:1 states that the word of the LORD came unto Ezekiel.

questions.question: Against which location was Ezekiel commanded to prophesy according to Ezekiel 35:2?
questions.correctAnswer: Mount Seir
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:2 commands Ezekiel to set his face against mount Seir and prophesy against it.

questions.question: What will God make Mount Seir according to Ezekiel 35:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Most desolate
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:3 says God will make Mount Seir most desolate.

questions.question: What will happen to the cities of Mount Seir as mentioned in Ezekiel 35:4?
questions.correctAnswer: They will be laid waste
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:4 states that God will lay the cities waste and make them desolate.

questions.question: Why was God against Mount Seir according to Ezekiel 35:5?
options: Because of their perpetual hatred and shedding the blood of Israel's children
Because they refused to build the temple
questions.correctAnswer: Because of their perpetual hatred and shedding the blood of Israel's children
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:5 explains that Mount Seir had perpetual hatred and shed the blood of Israel's children.

questions.question: What does God say will 'pursue' Mount Seir because it did not hate blood, according to Ezekiel 35:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Blood
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:6 states that blood shall pursue Mount Seir since it did not hate blood.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 35:7, what will happen to those who pass out and return from Mount Seir?
questions.correctAnswer: They will be cut off
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:7 says God will cut off those that pass out and return from Mount Seir.

questions.question: Where will the slain men fill according to Ezekiel 35:8?
questions.correctAnswer: Mountains, hills, valleys, and rivers
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:8 describes that the slain men will fill mountains, hills, valleys, and rivers.

questions.question: What will be the state of Mount Seir’s cities according to Ezekiel 35:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Perpetual desolations
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:9 declares that Mount Seir will have perpetual desolations and its cities will not return.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 35:10, what did Mount Seir claim about two nations and two countries?
options: They shall be theirs and they will possess it
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be theirs and they will possess it
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:10 says Mount Seir claimed these two nations and countries shall be theirs to possess.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 35:11 says God will act according to the anger and envy of Mount Seir.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:11 confirms God will do according to Mount Seir's anger and envy.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 35:12 states that God heard the blasphemies spoken against the mountains of Israel.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:12 says God heard all blasphemies spoken against the mountains of Israel.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 35:14 says God will rejoice when the whole earth rejoices.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:14 states God will make Mount Seir desolate when the whole earth rejoices, not that God rejoices.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Ezekiel 35:15: 'As thou didst rejoice at the inheritance of the house of Israel, because it was _______, so will I do unto thee.'
questions.correctAnswer: desolate
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:15 says Mount Seir rejoiced because the house of Israel was desolate, and so will God make Mount Seir desolate.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 35:15, who will know that the LORD is God after Mount Seir becomes desolate?
questions.correctAnswer: All of Idumea
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:15 states that all of Idumea, including Mount Seir, will know that the LORD is God.

medium.title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ezekiel Chapter 35 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with bitterness toward those who have wronged them. Based on Ezekiel 35, what biblical truth can you share about God's justice?
options: God will judge those who harbor hatred and act unjustly.
God ignores the actions of those who hate others.
God always blesses those who harm His people.
God wants us to retaliate with the same hatred.
questions.correctAnswer: God will judge those who harbor hatred and act unjustly.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:5-7 shows that God will prepare judgment against Mount Seir for its perpetual hatred and violence against Israel, emphasizing that God judges hatred and injustice.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 35 teach us about humility when facing trials or opposition?
options: Recognize that God is sovereign and will make Himself known in judgment.
Boast about our own strength to overcome enemies.
Ignore God's power and rely solely on human wisdom.
Seek revenge independently from God's guidance.
questions.correctAnswer: Recognize that God is sovereign and will make Himself known in judgment.
questions.explanation: Verses 11-12 reveal God's sovereignty and that He will make Himself known among the nations by judging those who blaspheme and oppose Him, teaching humility before God's power.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to hate those who have caused them harm. According to Ezekiel 35, what principle should guide their response?
options: Leave vengeance to God, who will judge hatred and bring justice.
questions.correctAnswer: Leave vengeance to God, who will judge hatred and bring justice.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:6-7 states that bloodshed and judgment will come upon those who hate and shed blood, indicating that God is the righteous judge and believers should trust Him rather than seek personal vengeance.

questions.question: What does Ezekiel 35 teach about the importance of trusting God's timing in delivering justice?
options: God will act in His perfect timing to bring desolation to the proud.
Justice must be meted out immediately by human hands.
God delays justice indefinitely without purpose.
Justice is irrelevant to God's plan.
questions.correctAnswer: God will act in His perfect timing to bring desolation to the proud.
questions.explanation: Verse 14 emphasizes that when the whole earth rejoices, God will make the proud desolate, showing that God's justice is purposeful and timed perfectly.

questions.question: How does this passage encourage believers to maintain integrity in their speech?
options: Avoid boasting and blasphemy against God's people and purposes.
Use harsh words to intimidate others.
Ignore the impact of words on others.
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid boasting and blasphemy against God's people and purposes.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:12-13 condemns the boasting and blasphemy spoken against Israel, teaching believers to guard their speech and speak with integrity.

questions.question: A believer feels discouraged because enemies claim God's blessings belong to them. What assurance does Ezekiel 35 provide?
options: God will judge those who envy and wrongfully claim His blessings.
God allows enemies to keep His blessings forever.
God is unaware of such claims.
God encourages believers to take blessings by force.
questions.correctAnswer: God will judge those who envy and wrongfully claim His blessings.
questions.explanation: Verse 10-11 explains that God will act upon the anger and envy of those who claim His inheritance, assuring believers of divine justice.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ezekiel 35, God will make Mount Seir a desolate place because it rejoiced over Israel's misfortune.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:15 states that because Mount Seir rejoiced over Israel's desolation, God will cause it to become desolate in turn.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 35 teaches that God's judgment is arbitrary and not related to the actions of the people.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: The chapter shows God's judgment is directly connected to the hatred, violence, and blasphemy of Mount Seir (Edom), indicating purposeful justice (Ezekiel 35:5-7, 12).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: According to Ezekiel 35, God will make Mount Seir most ______ and cut off those who pass out and return.
questions.correctAnswer: desolate
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:7 clearly states God will make Mount Seir most desolate and cut off those who pass out and return.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 35 teach about perseverance through trials when facing opposition from others?
options: Trust that God sees all and will bring justice in due time.
Give up immediately because the opposition is too strong.
Fight back using any means necessary.
Ignore all challenges and avoid prayer.
questions.correctAnswer: Trust that God sees all and will bring justice in due time.
questions.explanation: Verses 9 and 11 show that God will bring perpetual desolations on the enemies and make Himself known by judging them, encouraging believers to trust God's justice.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to boast about their own achievements. What warning does Ezekiel 35 provide regarding boasting?
options: Boasting against God will be heard and judged.
Boasting is encouraged to gain respect.
questions.correctAnswer: Boasting against God will be heard and judged.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:13 states that God has heard the boasting and multiplied words against Him, indicating that such behavior is condemned.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 35 encourage believers to respond to envy and anger directed toward them?
options: Trust God to judge and vindicate them.
Respond with envy and anger as well.
Ignore God and take matters into their own hands.
Refrain from prayer or seeking God.
questions.correctAnswer: Trust God to judge and vindicate them.
questions.explanation: Verse 11 explains God will act according to the anger and envy of the enemies and make Himself known by judging them, encouraging believers to trust God's justice.

questions.question: What does Ezekiel 35 teach about the consequences of shedding innocent blood?
options: Bloodshed will pursue those who shed it unjustly.
God blesses those who shed blood.
questions.correctAnswer: Bloodshed will pursue those who shed it unjustly.
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:6 states that because Mount Seir did not hate bloodshed, even blood will pursue it, showing the consequences of shedding innocent blood.

questions.question: How does this passage teach about God's faithfulness to His promises to His people?
options: God will defend His inheritance and judge those who wrong His people.
God abandons His people to their enemies.
God's promises are conditional on human strength alone.
God ignores the plight of His people.
questions.correctAnswer: God will defend His inheritance and judge those who wrong His people.
questions.explanation: Verses 10 and 15 affirm that God is present where His inheritance is and will act against those who rejoice in Israel's desolation, showing His faithfulness.

questions.question: In what way does Ezekiel 35 teach about the importance of recognizing God's sovereignty in daily life and work?
options: Acknowledging that God controls justice and outcomes encourages integrity and trust.
Sovereignty is irrelevant to daily decisions.
questions.correctAnswer: Acknowledging that God controls justice and outcomes encourages integrity and trust.
questions.explanation: The entire chapter emphasizes God's sovereign judgment over nations and individuals (e.g., verses 3, 9, 11), encouraging believers to trust Him in all aspects of life.

hard.title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ezekiel Chapter 35.

questions.question: Against which location does God command Ezekiel to prophesy in Ezekiel 35?
questions.correctAnswer: Mount Seir
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:2 explicitly states that Ezekiel is to set his face against mount Seir and prophesy against it.

questions.question: What is the primary reason God declares judgment against Mount Seir?
options: Its perpetual hatred and shedding of Israelite blood
questions.correctAnswer: Its perpetual hatred and shedding of Israelite blood
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:5 states that the judgment is because Mount Seir had a perpetual hatred and shed the blood of the children of Israel.

questions.question: In Ezekiel 35:6, what does God say will 'pursue' Mount Seir as judgment?
questions.correctAnswer: Blood
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:6 says that because Mount Seir did not hate blood, blood shall pursue it as judgment.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 35 depict the fate of the people on Mount Seir?
options: They will be cut off and their mountains filled with slain men
They will be exiled to Babylon
They will repent and be restored
questions.correctAnswer: They will be cut off and their mountains filled with slain men
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:7-8 describes that those who pass out and return will be cut off and the mountains filled with slain men.

questions.question: Which phrase in Ezekiel 35 emphasizes the certainty of God's judgment and its eternal nature?
questions.correctAnswer: "I will make thee perpetual desolations"
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:9 declares that God will make perpetual desolations, emphasizing enduring judgment.

questions.question: What claim made by Mount Seir provoked God's anger, as mentioned in Ezekiel 35:10?
options: That two nations and two countries shall be theirs
That they were chosen by God
That they had the right to worship idols
questions.correctAnswer: That two nations and two countries shall be theirs
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:10 states Mount Seir claimed two nations and countries as theirs, ignoring that the LORD was there.

questions.question: What does God say He will do 'according to thine anger and envy' in Ezekiel 35:11?
options: He will judge Mount Seir and make Himself known among Israel
He will unite them with Israel
questions.correctAnswer: He will judge Mount Seir and make Himself known among Israel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:11 explains that God will act according to their anger and envy by judging them and making Himself known among Israel.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 35:12, what has Mount Seir blasphemed against?
questions.correctAnswer: The mountains of Israel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:12 records that Mount Seir blasphemed against the mountains of Israel.

questions.question: Which literary device is prominently used in Ezekiel 35 to express God’s judgment and warning?
questions.correctAnswer: Prophetic oracle
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35 contains a prophetic oracle, a common literary device used to announce divine judgment and warnings.

questions.question: The phrase 'I will stretch out mine hand against thee' in Ezekiel 35:3 metaphorically signifies what?
questions.correctAnswer: God’s active intervention and judgment
questions.explanation: The phrase in Ezekiel 35:3 is a metaphor for God’s active judgment against Mount Seir.

questions.question: In historical context, who were the inhabitants of Mount Seir, the target of this prophecy?
questions.correctAnswer: The Edomites
questions.explanation: Mount Seir is historically associated with the Edomites, descendants of Esau, who were often hostile to Israel.

questions.question: True or False: Ezekiel 35 emphasizes that Mount Seir’s cities will be restored after their desolation.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:9 clearly states that the cities shall not return, indicating permanent desolation.

questions.question: What thematic parallel can be drawn between Ezekiel 35 and Deuteronomy 32 regarding Mount Seir?
options: Both describe Mount Seir’s hostility to Israel and impending judgment
Both recount Mount Seir’s alliance with Israel
Both describe Mount Seir as a sanctuary
questions.correctAnswer: Both describe Mount Seir’s hostility to Israel and impending judgment
questions.explanation: Deuteronomy 32 also portrays Mount Seir (Edom) as hostile to Israel, foreshadowing judgment, paralleling Ezekiel 35.

questions.question: Which theme in Ezekiel 35 foreshadows the New Testament teaching about judgment for persistent hostility to God's people?
options: Divine retribution for perpetual hatred and violence
The establishment of a political kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: Divine retribution for perpetual hatred and violence
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35’s emphasis on punishment for perpetual hatred prefigures New Testament teachings on judgment for persistent hostility.

questions.question: What does the repeated declaration 'that ye shall know that I am the LORD' emphasize in Ezekiel 35?
options: God’s sovereignty and the purpose of judgment
questions.correctAnswer: God’s sovereignty and the purpose of judgment
questions.explanation: Multiple verses (e.g., Ezekiel 35:4, 9, 11, 12, 15) repeat this phrase to highlight God's sovereign authority and intent behind judgment.

theological.title: Ezekiel Chapter 35 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ezekiel Chapter 35 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: Against which geographical location did God command Ezekiel to prophesy judgment in Ezekiel 35?
questions.correctAnswer: Mount Seir
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:2 instructs Ezekiel to set his face against Mount Seir and prophesy against it. This judgment reflects God's sovereign authority over all nations, consistent with prophetic declarations in Isaiah 34:5-6 and Jeremiah 49:17-18.

questions.question: What is the primary reason given for God's judgment upon Mount Seir?
options: Perpetual hatred and bloodshed against Israel
questions.correctAnswer: Perpetual hatred and bloodshed against Israel
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:5 states that the judgment is because Mount Seir had perpetual hatred and shed the blood of the children of Israel during their calamity. This aligns with the biblical principle that God judges nations for injustice and violence, as seen in Genesis 12:3 and Romans 12:19.

questions.question: How does God describe His action toward Mount Seir in Ezekiel 35:3?
options: I will make thee most desolate
I will give thee great wealth
questions.correctAnswer: I will make thee most desolate
questions.explanation: In Ezekiel 35:3, God declares He will stretch out His hand against Mount Seir and make it most desolate, revealing His sovereign judgment against hostile nations, consistent with His judgments in Joel 3:19 and Zephaniah 3:6.

questions.question: What will happen to the cities of Mount Seir according to Ezekiel 35:4?
options: They will be laid waste and become desolate
They will be rebuilt and prosper
They will be filled with pilgrims
They will be given to Israel
questions.correctAnswer: They will be laid waste and become desolate
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:4 promises that the cities will be laid waste and desolated, emphasizing divine retribution for sin. This theme echoes God's judgment on cities like Sodom in Genesis 19:24-25 and Babylon in Isaiah 13:19.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 35:6, what will pursue Mount Seir because of its hatred of blood?
questions.correctAnswer: Blood
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:6 states that because Mount Seir did not hate blood, blood shall pursue it, illustrating the principle of divine justice and retributive judgment found in Proverbs 11:31 and Revelation 6:10.

questions.question: What ultimate knowledge will the desolation of Mount Seir bring according to Ezekiel 35:9?
options: They shall know that I am the LORD
They shall know the strength of their armies
They shall know the wisdom of their leaders
They shall know the power of their idols
questions.correctAnswer: They shall know that I am the LORD
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:9 emphasizes that the desolation will lead to the recognition of God's sovereign lordship, a key biblical motif seen throughout Scripture such as in Exodus 10:2 and Isaiah 45:5.

questions.question: What accusation does God make against Mount Seir in Ezekiel 35:10 regarding territory?
options: They claimed the lands of two nations as their own
They worshiped idols on the holy mount
They refused to trade with Israel
They built altars to other gods
questions.correctAnswer: They claimed the lands of two nations as their own
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:10 records that Mount Seir arrogantly said the lands of two nations would be theirs despite the LORD's presence, highlighting human pride and territorial greed condemned in Numbers 20:14-21 and Psalm 2:1-3.

questions.question: How does God say He will respond to the anger and envy Mount Seir has shown in Ezekiel 35:11?
options: He will act according to their anger and envy and make Himself known
He will forgive and restore them
questions.correctAnswer: He will act according to their anger and envy and make Himself known
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:11 reveals that God will execute judgment in response to their hatred and envy, making Himself known through His righteous acts, consistent with God's justice seen in Psalms 7:11 and Romans 12:19.

questions.question: What blasphemous claim had Mount Seir made against the mountains of Israel, as stated in Ezekiel 35:12?
options: They said the mountains are laid desolate and given to them to consume
They claimed the mountains were gods
They said the mountains were cursed forever
They declared the mountains would never be rebuilt
questions.correctAnswer: They said the mountains are laid desolate and given to them to consume
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:12 states Mount Seir's blasphemy that Israel's mountains were desolate and theirs to consume, reflecting arrogance against God's people as seen in Jeremiah 12:7 and Obadiah 1:10.

questions.question: According to Ezekiel 35:13, how did Mount Seir express its defiance against God?
options: By boasting and multiplying words against God
By fasting and praying for mercy
questions.correctAnswer: By boasting and multiplying words against God
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:13 describes Mount Seir's arrogance in boasting against God, a behavior condemned throughout Scripture such as in Psalm 10:3 and Isaiah 10:6.

questions.question: What will happen to Mount Seir when the whole earth rejoices, according to Ezekiel 35:14?
options: Mount Seir will be made desolate
questions.correctAnswer: Mount Seir will be made desolate
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:14 states that when all the earth rejoices, Mount Seir will be made desolate, displaying God's sovereignty over nations and eschatological justice as also seen in Isaiah 34:1-4 and Revelation 19:17-18.

questions.question: What parallel does God make between Mount Seir's rejoicing over Israel's inheritance and His judgment in Ezekiel 35:15?
options: As Mount Seir rejoiced over Israel's desolation, so it will be desolate
As Mount Seir helped Israel, so it will be rewarded
As Mount Seir remained neutral, so it will be spared
As Mount Seir mourned, so it will be comforted
questions.correctAnswer: As Mount Seir rejoiced over Israel's desolation, so it will be desolate
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35:15 declares that just as Mount Seir rejoiced at Israel's desolation, it will itself be desolate, illustrating God's principle of divine retribution found in Luke 6:38 and Galatians 6:7.

questions.question: What does Ezekiel 35 teach about God's attribute of justice?
options: God executes righteous judgment against nations for their sins
God ignores the sins of hostile nations
God shows partiality only to Israel
God punishes only individuals, not nations
questions.correctAnswer: God executes righteous judgment against nations for their sins
questions.explanation: Throughout Ezekiel 35, God's justice is displayed in His active judgment against Mount Seir for its hatred and violence, consistent with His justice in Deuteronomy 32:35, Psalm 9:7-8, Romans 2:6, and Revelation 20:12.

questions.question: How does Ezekiel 35 illustrate God's sovereignty over the nations?
options: God commands judgment on Mount Seir, showing His control over all peoples
God only focuses on Israel and ignores other nations
God allows nations to act independently without intervention
God promises blessings to all nations regardless of behavior
questions.correctAnswer: God commands judgment on Mount Seir, showing His control over all peoples
questions.explanation: The chapter demonstrates God's supreme authority in ordering judgment on Mount Seir, reflecting His sovereignty seen in Psalm 22:28, Daniel 4:35, Matthew 28:18, and Revelation 4:11.

questions.question: What eschatological theme is present in Ezekiel 35 regarding the fate of hostile nations?
options: Hostile nations will face ultimate desolation and recognition of God
Hostile nations will be absorbed into Israel
Hostile nations will be eternally blessed
questions.correctAnswer: Hostile nations will face ultimate desolation and recognition of God
questions.explanation: Ezekiel 35 presents the future desolation of Mount Seir and resulting acknowledgment of the LORD, aligning with eschatological judgment in Isaiah 24:1-6, Joel 3:12-16, Matthew 25:31-46, and Revelation 20:7-10.
